entries.content: User reports options dropdown in bottom toolbar opens downward (hidden below viewport) instead of upward. Need to make it open upward WITHOUT affecting the header dropdown which opens downward correctly. Both dropdowns share styling/components.

DISCOVERY: options-dropdown.css is a standalone clone of header dropdown styles. Header dropdown uses modular @import architecture with dropdown-base.css. Both have triangle connectors pointing UP (border-bottom, top: -6px). Need to flip ONLY bottom dropdown to open upward with triangle pointing DOWN.
DECISION: User approved CSS modifier approach for upward-opening dropdown. Will add .opens-upward modifier class to options-dropdown.css and apply it via JavaScript in the dropdown controller.

Architecture: DropdownDOMBuilder creates menu element. Need to add 'opens-upward' class to menu element during build. Will modify CSS to add upward-opening styles under .options-dropdown-menu.opens-upward selector.

SUCCESS: Added .opens-upward modifier class to options dropdown. Modified options-dropdown.css (lines 240-272) with upward positioning and flipped triangle. Applied class in DropdownDOMBuilder.js line 87. Header dropdown unaffected.
User requested 30% width reduction for options dropdown menu. Changed min-width from 200px to 140px (30% reduction = 140px).
Task complete: User confirmed dropdown works perfectly. Opening upward with correct triangle positioning and 30% reduced width. Ready to create delta memory.

COMPLETE: Created delta memory for options-dropdown-upward-opening-implementation. Documented CSS modifier approach, triangle flipping gotchas, and 30% width reduction. User satisfied with implementation.
User requested reorder of bottom toolbar: dropdown → edit mode → thinking mode. Moved options-dropdown-container to first position in user-input.html.
